definition[0]: the total value of a company’s shares
example[0]: The company’s capitalisation has increased to $81.5 billion.
example[1]: There were strong gains in large capitalization shares such as shipbuilding and steel companies.
example[2]: The early drop wiped around £800 million off the company’smarket capitalisation.
definition[1]: the total value of all the shares on a stockmarket at a particular time
example[3]: Share prices are so low that the total market capitalization of the Seoul stock exchange last week amounted to only 66,000 billion Won.
